pullRequest.title: Add more pagination testing to query and relationship tests
pullRequest.bodyText:
Also update readme to reflect recent changes to project folder structure.
Now pagination tests will check that continuation tokens are provided for non-terminal pages, and that all non-terminal pages have the page size that the SDK specifies

commit.message:
Add more pagination testing to query and relationship tests

Also update readme to reflect recent changes to project folder structure

nodes.bodyText: We deleted the local swagger copy, so we don't need this part of our readme anymore
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -59,11 +59,14 @@ You can familiarize yourself with different APIs using [samples for Digital Twin
 - The Digital Twins public sync and async clients [`DigitalTwinsClient`](https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/digitaltwins/azure-digitaltwins-core/src/main/java/com/azure/digitaltwins/core/DigitalTwinsClient.java), [`DigitalTwinsAsyncClient`](https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/digitaltwins/azure-digitaltwins-core/src/main/java/com/azure/digitaltwins/core/DigitalTwinsAsyncClient.java)

-### /src/swagger

nodes.bodyText:
Can this be something more like:
    assertThat("Number of pages must be more than 1",
           outgoingRelationshipsPagecount.get(),
           greaterThan(1));
In .NET at least, doing a comparison rather than asserting true or false gets you better test failure output.
weird spacing issues in this statement
The file names are strange aren't they? [1]? when did that happen? do you know why?
hmm, I expected this to be the BULK_RELATIONSHIP_COUNT instead of pageSize
I think in this case you are only creating 5 relationships no? that's smaller than the default page size of 10
